Name: Jar
Description: Pottery vase with rounded base, wide waist, and tall constricted neck. The vessel was found in one of the fourth millennium BC graves at the key early settlement near Kom el-Ahmar (the Hierakonpolis of later texts) in southern Upper Egypt. The burial contained a contracted skeleton with matting over the face, and coarse cloth. There was a cosmetic palette with pebble for grinding green copper ore as eye-paint, and a set of pottery, of which five items were sent by the excavators to Dublin.
